title: Fun
text:
Lovely decor, nice food. Good service with a pleasant price. Several dishes to try including some specials.

No alcohol unfortunately.

Good location in JLT

Worth a visit.

title: Lovely greeting and seating - Catrina
text:
Lovely greeting and seating from Catrina who also served me throughout my visit.

I sat outside to enjoy the fresh air and the view. Lots of greenery and plenty happening.

Hot delicious coffee followed up by a freshly made salad. Chef did a great job.

Love the atmosphere and seating, perfect , polite service. Would definitely come back.

title: Variety
text:
Fish market is close to the ferry and downtown.

Open air, but fresh and a good turnover. Much to choose from and no regrets

title: That Fits
text:
Firstly, you cannot expect too much in Dar Es Salaam.

However, this is a Marriott hotel and it delivers on the brand.

Checkin was smooth, received a good room, and found everything at the hotel convenient. The staff in particular were helpful and had a positive yes we can do that attitude.

Lisa, Linda, Charles and Joel led the way. Also impressive were my housemaids, and the restaurant staff. Actually, all the staff added to my stay.

The gym was good, overlooking a very useable swimming pool.

Loved the breakfast, but dinner was even better.

Yes, i’d definitely stay again.
place: Four Points By Sheraton Dar Es Salaam New Africa

title: Location Alice Location
text:
This hotel has a great location with a Supermarket attached.

Gym was closed as was the Executive Lounge but the hotel gave me a few vouchers to use in their bar. Like a lot of the world you can easily catch covid in an Executive Lounge but it is impossible to get it in a Hotel Bar where you pay extra.

My room was large and comfortable. Breakfast surprisingly good for covid times.

Alice on reception was the star. Pure class, simply put an asset to the hotel.

Would love to visit again.

title: Mixed Bag
text:
Had a 4 day stay at this hotel which I thoroughly enjoyed.

The rooms are a little dated and small, but the hotel has a good gym, a first class pool and a great breakfast. The Club Lounge is small, but has everything you need.

The annoying part of my stay was the keys cards didnt work most of the time. I made so many trips to reception to get them working. Still, not a biggie.

Ose in the restaurant was the standout member of staff. She had a friendly smile and was always busy. She really did enhance my stay.

Also need to mention Friday, the doorman on the elevators. Great attitude , great guy, well done.

Yes, I would stay again.

title: Ose
text:
I stayed at the Sheraton for a few days and enjoyed dining at the Pumpkin Leaf.

It’s a bit hectic and disorganised, but the food was good and well presented.

For breakfast there was a buffet, that offered local and international food. I took my breakfast outside after the first day, aa it was less noisy.

The staff generally have poor customer service skills and looked unhappy. The exception was Ose, who had a charming smile and tried her best to keep up with the many demands asked of her. Appreciated the extra effort she made.

Would recommend this restaurant.

title: No Service
text:
Booked online as this hotels had good reviews.

Can only assume the people that wrote those reviews got the address wrong and stayed in a different hotel.

Room was not cleaned, rubbish still in the bin from previous guests. Tea/coffee not replenished. Felt dirty.

Breakfast was disgusting. They had two hot dishes but one was gone by the time i got there and never refilled. Complained to management but they did nothing about it. Dont know how hygenic any of it was.

Poor standards, would never stay again.

I did like the outdoor seating and they had Lipton Tea !

title: Sara
text:
I just stayed at this hotel and want to congratulate management on the hotel and staffing team. I had a perfect stay.

In particular , Sara on reception stood out. Her check-in was delightful. She was Professional, friendly and well groomed.

The room she gave me was perfect.

I really hope I get back to Tirana again, just so I can stay at this hotel.

Thank you.

title: Worth a walk around
text:
Lovely lake. Walkways are well set out.

Pets welcome.

Loved the views.

Do take the time to explore. Cafes and shops scattered around the lake.

title: Perfect stay
text:
Perfect Stay !

Nice check in late at night, and efficient friendly checkout in the morning. Polite well groomed staff.

Breakfast was good for covid times !

Room had everything you need with a super comfortable bed.

The key difference was the staff. Angelika and Teresa at breakfast were a great team. Well presented, happy and continually providing top service.

Great location too!

Would definitely stay here again.

title: So Friendly
text:
Brand New Hotel in a great area.

Mall downstairs that has everything.

Magnificent room complete with a perfect bath. Views over the city.

Staff and management were so helpful, with Enura going the extra distance. Wonderful, well chosen and friendly.

Would love to stay again.

title: Worth Seeing
text:
Doesn’t take long to include this in your day, so it’s worth a look.

Not spectacular but you can tick it off the list. It’s often on tv, so once seen you can say: I’ve been there!

title: Tui
text:
Quick friendly check in and I was given a superb upgrade. My room had awesome views and it felt comfortable.

Gym was closed, but all other hotel facilities were open.

Tui in the Lounge provided some nice conversation along with exceptional service. She went that little bit extra and that made a huge difference to my stay. All the staff I encountered were well trained and particularly good at there jobs.

Luciana at breakfast really stood out as well. Energenic, smiling and engaging.

This has to be the #1 Marriott in London. Can’t wait to get back.

title: Mixed
text:
Nice greeting and check-in by Irina at reception. A touch of class there.

My room was a little unusual in that it had two single beds when I had requested one queen. I can’t imagine why two people would share such a small room in seperate beds?

Bar 208 had very forgetful waitresses and the food comes in super small portions.

Breakfast was good, as was the service.

This is still a very good hotel and worth a try. It avoids the lengthy drive into Moscow itself.
place: DoubleTree By Hilton Moscow - Vnukovo Airport

title: Hare
text:
Strange name, not sure about this one, but it was worth a look.

Busy day, not sure of the best comments to make ....

title: Classic
text:
This hotel has a nice feel about it, and is right downtown.

My room was good, with a large bathroom. Had everything I needed.

Lovely, relaxing breakfast.

Check out by Vlada was professional and friendly , leaving a good last impression.

title: Not what you expect
text:
Such a famous place, with so much importance and history, you will be amazed at how commercial it is.

The whole square is surrounded by tourist shops ????

A terrible waste if a National Treasure.

title: Great service
text:
Great service in a spacious, well set out restaurant.

All the staff gave excellent service, and the chef sure can cook! Great food.
place: Marriott royal aurora hotel aurora resturant

title: Marsida
text:
Nice entrance and a great check in from Marsida, who provided excellent help and service throughout my staff.

Loved the proximity to the beach, where the water is warm and ideal for swimming.

Room was large, and breakfast was good with lovely outdoor seating overlooking the beach.

Would love to stay again.

Thank you Marsida !

title: Cerem
text:
Great check in from Melissa, who gave me a nice Garden View room. I upgraded to a Seaview room the next day for only 6 dollars more. Melissa was friendly and informative.

Both types of rooms were quite dated, but still comfortable.

The location and facilities of this hotel are good, the beach area is a real plus +++

What makes this hotel exceptional is the super friendly staff. The star of the show is Cerem. She popped up all over the Resort and added real value. Thank you to her and all the other staff that made my stay memorable.

I’d love to stay there again.

title: Super Staff
text:
Classic street appeal from the outside and convenient inside.

Classy, friendly check-in from the very capable Marianna. She couldn’t be more helpful. Didn’t miss a thing. Staff make all the difference in a staff, and this hotel has great staff.

Loved my room with it’s views of the Square.

Chef Varn made the best breakfast i have had in a decade. Completely made my stay. This man can definitely cook. Really appreciate this.

Gym was good too.

I can thoroughly recommend this hotel and hope I get back soon.

title: Sleep
text:
Not much happening here. Very quiet, not atmosphere. I was there early evening and the place was deserted.

Oh well, had some spare time.

title: Disorganised Chaos
text:
The start of my stay was disappointing. Rooms booked on booking.com and expedia - paid for but nothing available.

Marica did a good job given the circumstances, but I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

It’s a pity, as it has a great location and nice views from the rooftop. Shower and aircon work well. It feels like a backpackers, but the price is 3-4 star hotel.
place: ZIBIBBO SUITES & ROOMS XIX Palazzo Mauro

title: Alexandra
text:
Very nice welcome from Katy in reception who gave friendly helpful service throughout my stay.

My room was nice, had everything you needed.

Breakfast was basic, but the great service from Alexandra made it most enjoyable. Nice outdoor seating.

Great location, I would stay there again.

title: Raghida
text:
I recently stayed at the above hotel 2-3 August and 3-4 August 2020.

Beirut and the hotel have been hit hard by COVID-19 but the Hotel is still managing to provide good service and a comfortable stay. This hotel has all the Marriott Bonvoy benefits, and the prices are extremely competitive.

Whilst the hotel itself is a little dated, it has all the facilities required, and the location is in the City, not too far from the waterfront.

The key to any hotel are the staff. I would like to mention Raghida as she provided exceptional service. She was well presented, friendly and made sure where possible that my stay was as comfortable as could be. (she has been well selected and trained - congrats to management)

With service like that, I can recommend this Hotel, and look forward to my next stay. Please pass on my thanks to Raghida.
place: Four Points by Sheraton Le Verdun

title: Bricks
text:
Nice bricks but nothing really to see, a purist might enjoy looking at the cement and perhaps the design, but after 20-30 seconds you might start counting the number of cars driving by or looking at the more interesting pigeons.

A wonderful attraction for a very limited few.

title: Not Marriott Standard
text:
Arrived at the hotel to find they won’t pay for a taxi and put it on your account. Great start.

Given an upgrade and was told it is an exceptional room. Arrived to find it very average and old. Not comfortable to use and fashioned in brown.

No fridge, no tea coffee, aircon didnt work, and the bathtub was dripping with a loose faucet. Asked for maintenance to fix it, they tried and got one side partially working.

Aurelie in the breakfast restaurant saved the stay with her friendly and attentive service. Nice food.

Checked out after one night. My room was next to an amusement park. Just too noisey. No balcony, just a bad feeling.

Terrace Restaurant downstairs was nice.

title: Steel
text:
Big hunk of steel that acts as a reference for Navigation.

Nothing special, too commercial. Too many street vendors and people wondering why they came there in the first place.

title: Aurilie
text:
Not such a great entrance as you walk into this dark restaurant - nice to have a bit of colour and brightness for breakfast.

However, the service was great with Aurilie showing her class and friendliness. She turned and average breakfast into a good one. The food was fresh and well presented. Teapot needs to be bigger.

Thank you Aurilie (Aurelie) ?

title: Classic
text:
The driveway of the Hanbury is scenic and spectacular. The hotel itself is in a very old building that looks a bit like a castle, and this adds to the character of the stay.

Nice check-in and given a huge room. Later - The check-out with Chris was even better, leaving a good impression.

Set on huge grounds and a golf course, if you like nature and the countryside, this place is perfect.

However, it is quite isolated so come prepared.

Given it’s size and location, this hotel should be offering full Marriott benefits including an Executive Lounge - sadly it does not. Another concept might be to consider all inclusive packages. The hotel is tucked away from everything, i personally like this, but perhaps it’s not for everyone.

The breakfast was very nice and at night there is ample outdoor seating overlooking the golf course and a pond to accomodate everyone’s tastes.

Would definitely staff again, but packages and deals need a revamp.
place: Hanbury Manor Marriott Hotel & Country Club

title: 5 Star plus
text:
Great check in and superb first impression when you walk in the foyer (reception).

My room was world class with entertaining marina views / sea view.

Breakfast was lovely, with a stylish greeting from Ivona each day. The service from Marina my waitress was friendly, and she anticipated my needs well. She set the standard.

Pure class from Ivoni, Marija and Dario on reception. Well trained, well spoken and very helpful.

So sad to leave here, coulda stayed for months ......

title: Marina
text:
Superb setting for a restaurant and it has it all.

The staff do make the difference and Spalatum has some good ones. In particular Marina stood out with her great work ethic and friendliness.

Being served by her was a pleasure and I believe the other guests felt this way too.

At times some of the staff seemed a little disorganised, but all were very polite and helpful.

I can definitely recommend this as a must do to dine.

title: Quality Plus
text:
Great hotel from top to bottom.

Has everything you need onsite so you can stay self contained.

Breakfast was the highlight for me with Sayora providing super friendly , exceptional service. The chef also contributed with well prepared and nicely presented meals.

Loved the pool, the views, the layout.

2 small areas of improvement:

The aircon didnt go cool enough,
The refrigerator in my room was far to small and didnt cool properly.

I would definitely stay at this hotel again.
place: The Westin La Quinta Golf Resort & Spa, Benahavis, Marbella

title: The Westin Switch
text:
Booked with Le Merdien but was switched to her sister hotel, The Westin, due to renovations. It’s right next door, perfect location. No complaints from me!

Super efficient, friendly, and well prepared check-in from Kareem and Hussain. What a great start.

Popped up to the Executive Lounge and was greeted by a delightful Livina. Great service as well.

My room was World Class. Bathroom exceptional. Pics speak for themselves.

Used the Executive Lounge again in the morning, again perfect service from Aisha. (Forgive my spelling).

I must congratulate management on selecting and training these exceptional staff. We all know it’s staff who make the point of difference.

Thoroughly recommend this hotel to anyone.

title: Tough Times
text:
This hotel was open during COVID-19 and was worth a visit.

Mohamed on reception welcomed us and was very professional, didnt miss a thing. He started the stay on an ideal note.

My room was exceptional, one of the best i’ve had. Perfect bathroom.

Gym, restaurants were closed, but we were allowed a basic service in the executive lounge. This was a takeaway service. Not sure why the drinks were limited to 2, or how this prevents the spread of the virus. However , Winona was the star of the hotel. Like Mohamed, she has been well selected and well trained. Congrats to management on that. Her service was superb, and she coped with many guests by herself. Great personality too.

Grateful with the room service breakfast, but disappointed by the options and quality.

That aside, this is the best Marriott Hotel in Bahrain. Would definitely come back.

title: Quick look
text:
Not spectacular or wow, but definitely worth a look.

As you walk along the Corniche, this crops up and is worth a pic or two.

Another free activity

title: New and nice
text:
I have been to the old corniche a few times, just to hang out and see the sights.

Went to the new corniche just slightly further along and also enjoyed my stroll.

Both are free and right next to the sea. Worth the walk.

title: The COVID-19 excuse again !
text:
I’ve stayed at this hotel before, so I thought I knew what to expect.

Had a friendly checkin from Nadine, who gave me a sea view room when i requested it.

The room was nice, with a bathtub and tiny balcony, but it does have a seaview. Disappointed there is no tea or coffee in the room, just two small bottles of water.

Executive Lounge is also closed. I asked why, but no reason was given. This is also not shown on the website when you go to make a booking. It’s strange, as the bar upstairs was open, and there was even a wedding function held - no COVID-19 precautions in place. I think the hotel is cutting costs in this respect and not honouring the obligations set out under the Hilton Honors rules. Perhaps a compromise can be reached, like allowing members to use the bar with a meal in lieu of the lounge remaining closed? Or a $20 credit towards food and beverage.

My biggest disappointment was with the breakfast - bread, bread and more bread. No tomatoes, bacon, sausages, eggs, mushrooms, cold cuts, cheese or even cereal. Just bread. I advised reception i cannot eat just bread for breakfast and asked them to add two fried eggs. They did 21000 Lebanese pounds extra thank you very much. What a rip off.

In fact, the whole breakfast is a rip off. Sure they can provide eggs, but at a ridiculous cost. The guy who brought the uncovered food trolley to my room was not wearing a mask or gloves, so this has nothing to do with COVID-19. Simply trying to cut costs.

As i said i have stayed at this hotel before and enjoyed my stay. This is my first Hilton stay this year. At this stage I felt let down and think management needs to reconsider the services and amenities offered. In the meantime, the website for this hotel needs to mention continental breakfast in room only, and Executive Lounge closed.

title: Old
text:
Disjointed older looking hotel with a poor layout.

The rooms were much better, but still in need of renovations. No bathtub.

Loved the carpet in the hallway, well chosen.

Breakfast was excellent. Queema and Al Jafrezi.

Told by reception that normal Marriott Benefits dont apply as they have reduced staffing at present?

Suitable for 1 night only. Would try elsewhere next time.

title: Much improved
text:
The availability and service provided by Dubai Taxis is much improved.

Nearly all taxis accept credit card and with the roads having less traffic at present, the ride is usually better.

Lets hope this continues.

title: Terrible Breakfast
text:
I made a booking at the edelweiss hotel and was later advised by email that it was closed and my booking was transferred to the Royal Hotel.

The check-in was fine and my room was ok, just old and very small.

Breakfast was a joke. I seated myself and was acknowledged 5 minutes later by a waiter. After another 5 minutes he dropped off a bowl of bread and asked if i wanted tea or coffee.

He brought me some butter after 5 minutes - still frozen. Then after another 5 minutes some coffee.

About 15 minutes after this i waved him down and asked if i could order. Fried eggs and bacon please to which he said yes yes.

After i had finished the pot of coffee he came back and said no bacon was left. I asked him if he could get the chef to prepare some more.

5 minutes later he came back and said you are lucky, the chef has just arrived and is preparing your bacon now !

Another 5 minutes and another waiter brought me a ham and cheese omelette. I told him i didnt order it, i had ordered two fried eggs.

A few minutes later he brought out 2 fried eggs by themselves. I told him i had also ordered toast and bacon. He explained no bacon was left ! I told him the above story but he insisted no bacon. I asked for cooked ham instead. After 6-7 mins some chopped up ham arrived. I asked where is the toast? He apologised and said he will get some.

He then started clearing tables. My toast arrived 10 minutes later when my eggs were thoroughly cold.

The stay was ok, but the breakfast ruined the experience.

title: Prison
text:
For those wishing to experience prison life without actually going to prison, the Niranta is perfect.

Noel/Nol ? Did a great job of checking us in. We preordered the American Breakfast - safest option? And asked if that included sausages and bacon. He actually phoned the ‘chef’ while we were there an he confirmed that it was included and available. Great Customer Service from Noel.

That’s where it ended.

My room was tiny with no window or view. Internet and television did not work. In an airport hotel you mainly want to rest or sleep. Not here, with paper thin walls and no noise control, almost impossible.

Breakfast arrived on time but was unedible. See pic. No bacon or sausages as promised and despite 3 phone calls and visiting reception, and many promises, they never turned up. The rest of the breakfast consisted of some sort of sloppy cereal, a sauce of some kind, 2 bits of milk bread and an overcooked omelette. This has resulted when someone is thrown into a job with no training and no desire to be there. How anybody could have pride in presenting that to a customer is beyond cognition. I think they called this person chef, maybe they have really good humour and I missed the point.

My recommendation is don’t under any circumstance stay at this hotel.

title: Management Fail
text:
30 minutes from Male, this little island provides a nice little getaway.

The cottages are world class, with immediate access to the sea from the ample decking. Luxury inside, practical outside.

The food was terrible. Ruined the whole stay.

Our booking was done through an agent, who only booked bed and breakfast. For a much lesser price, all inclusive was available on booking.com and Expedia. A huge mistake to go thru an agent - can only imagine there must be some dealings going on. Dinner would add over USD 50 per dayif you did not have all inclusive ...... plus drinks! I ordered some milk in my room for a cup of tea and they charged USD 10 !!!

The lesson here is don’t go to the Maldives unless you have all inclusive.

We tried to upgrade to all inclusive but management held fast on 90USD a day. We offered 70 but no negotiation so we held fast and went basic. They missed out !

Expedia offered the rooms all inclusive for 150. (Something doesnt add up here???)

The service was friendly and welcoming, but the stay was ruined by management not willing to negotiate and poor quality food. I have stayed at other islands at lessor prices who offer much better quality. I would not go back here.

title: Too pricey
text:
Good location, ideal for people watching.

Service was slow, food was ok but overpriced.

Better to try local places.

title: It will do
text:
Great little hotel very close to the promenade and the beach.

Friendly staff - special mention to Julie who provided a superb checkin. She also gave me a great upgrade.

The business centre was not set up so i experienced a delay for its use. Also the keyboards are set up in a different type to what is on the keyboard. Very difficult to use - not much common sense shown there.

Breakfast was average.

The bar upstairs is unappealing and overpriced. Nice pool though. Gave it a wide berth and went to some local bars with atmosphere and 30% cheaper drinks.

However, overall a good stay.

title: Perfect
text:
What an investment.

Super for walking, cycling, skating, dogs, and brilliant sea views. Fresh air and exercise.

title: Great service
text:
Still COVID-19 times but the hotel was starting to ‘open up’.

Polite and accomodating staff, and the location is excellent.

Room was tiny. It had everything you needed, just very compact. Awesome views of the promenade and sea from my tiny, tiny balcony.

Breakfast was okay. The service was superb. Special mention of Vladimar, who has to be the most polite waiter i have met. Well done and thanks to all for the enjoyable breakfast.

Hotel price was reasonable.
place: Westminster Hotel & Spa, BW Premier Collection

title: Cold
text:
Chose the Westin as it has a good location.

Checkin in was basic, with only the breakfast timings mentioned. Was recognised as a Bonvoy Member, let alone as an Ambassador.

The room was standard, but had nice views. No tea/coffee, no fridge, no bath.

Breakfast was a choice of crossaints or cereal. Bitterly disappointed.

The whole experience felt cold. I realise it is difficult times, but I expect more from a Marriott.

title: Good views
text:
This attraction is basically right in town and a definite must do. Very easy to get too with breathtaking views.

Take some water with you.

title: Needs a rethink
text:
Nice stay at this hotel except the pricing of the food.

My room was spacious with a good balcony.

Breakfast was included but only continental. Add 2 eggs for 9 euro - extortion and very disappointing.

Would stay again if a cooked breakfast was included. Nb this is not an option you can select on expedia.

title: Perfection
text:
The stay started with a great booking experience from Angela. Told her what we wanted and she was able to provide everything.

The rooms were sound, secure and private. Nice patio and some excellent English rain made the stay. Nice green country setting including local ducks.

Breakfast was world class. Magnificent service throughout.

The price was at least half that of a similar quality hotel. For a few nights - perfect.

title: Refreshing
text:
Took a few minutes to walk around on the way to shopping. It was worth my while.

Good to get back to nature and feel like you are in the countryside.

title: Classy
text:
Great check in and the room met my expectations.

Very polite, friendly service all round by every staff member I encountered. Orly and Roman were the stars, they must have been well selected and trained, well done management.

My room had a great view of the mountains, very picturesque.

During a difficult COVID-19 breakfast stayed open. Sadly could not use the rest of the hotel facilities.

Thoroughly recommend this hotel and I would come back.

title: Tough Times
text:
This hotel was open during COVID-19 and was worth a visit.

Mohamed on reception welcomed us and was very professional, didnt miss a thing. He started the stay on an ideal note.

My room was exceptional, one of the best i’ve had. Perfect bathroom.

Gym, restaurants were closed, but we were allowed a basic service in the executive lounge. This was a takeaway service. Not sure why the drinks were limited to 2, or how this prevents the spread of the virus. However , Winona was the star of the hotel. Like Mohamed, she has been well selected and well trained. Congrats to management on that. Her service was superb, and she coped with many guests by herself. Great personality too.

Grateful with the room service breakfast, but disappointed by the options and quality.

That aside, this is the best Marriott Hotel in Bahrain. Would definitely come back.

title: peaceful
text:
A great way to fill in an afternoon/evening.

See the lake up close with some beautiful landscape. Very relaxing.

Worth doing, perhaps it's a one off, but glad I did it.
place: Real Journeys - TSS Earnslaw Vintage Steamship Cruises

title: Alyzza
text:
Perfect stay from start to finish.

Nice arrival greeted by friendly staff. Offered a check-in upstairs in the Executive Lounge. Quick and comfortable check-in with a welcome drink.

Fantastic room, with a large bathroom containing a bath, and a seperate lounge. Perfect.

Nice views, and modern. Throughout my stay Liz was my room attendant and she did a wonderful job.

The gym is good, and breakfast is World Class. All the staff I encountered were well selected and well trained.

The Executive Lounge has everything and more. Jenny the Customer Relations Manager introduced herself and made sure I felt welcome. The Lounge has the best views in town, and ample seating. A huge plus, is it also serve real food - not just snacks or nibbles, but a buffet of well prepared and well presented hot and cold dishes. In addition to this, they actually have chefs on-site preparing a few dishes as well. Talk about being spoilt.

A special mention to Alyzza. Pure Class. If I had a hotel she would be my first pick.

Check out was quick and simple, again in the Executive Lounge. I genuinely felt sad to leave. No hesitation in recommending this hotel, and for sure I will stay again.

title: Fun
text:
Lots to do here. Riding across the creek on an ABBRA is fun, cheap and you get to see lots, worth trying.

Both sides offer differents things including shops, markets and sights.

One of the better attractions in Dubai.

title: Good Service
text:
Very busy evening but we got seated in a reasonable time. It took a little longer to get our order taken but Alvin did a good job. Menu offers good variety.

The food and drinks arrived quickly and were nicely prepared. Small portions for the price i thought, but very tasty. Mary Joy attended us a few times and was pleasant - good service.

Restaurant offers free wifi.

Would come again.

title: Rama
text:
I visited this hotel at the same time as Storm Sabine. It was busy due to flight cancellations but I still had a lovely stay.

Rama on Reception was exceptional. Efficient, well presented and she knew her job well. Beyond that, she added a touch of class. Well spoken with a very friendly manner, she started my stay on a good note. Check in couldnt have been better.

Loved the ipad roulette wheel to
Win a prize !!!!

Nice room, spacious, with a view of the airport. Slept well.

Breakfast was good.

Short stay but would definitely come back.

Thank you Rama.
place: Sheraton Paris Airport Hotel & Conference Centre

title: Nice to view
text:
Worth a look at as you exercise along the boullevard.

Easy to get to, and free!

Take a few pics , it will job your memory of the surroundings.

title: Value
text:
Great hotel right next to the Corporate Airport LTBA. The location is right next to the sea with great views.

There is a boullevard that runs for miles for a fresh walk, exercise or a few restaurants and cafes.

Very polite service from the front desk.

Delicious breakfast with friendly helpful attendance from Beyza. She was consistently happy and let of a good vibe.

Nice gym too.

I would definitely recommend this property.

title: Jessy
text:
Brand new magnificent hotel in the Centre of Baretto (Baloy Beach).

Easily the best hotel in town. Perfect location, stunning views, right on the beach with instant access.

Super clean, the housemaids are world class.

Reception staff are friendly, well trained and immaculately presented. Great checkin from Claire and super service throughout my stay and checkout by Jessy. Touch of class.

Hotel needs a gym. Also there are no specials for the restaurant. No encouragement to dine there. Needs a rethink.

I strongly suggest a bed and breakfast deal to get the ball rolling.

title: Mira Mira
text:
Great check in and even better check out from the friendly Mira.

Hotel looks and feels new, even though it is several years old now.

Rooms are small, but they do the job. Great location too .....

Lobby Bar is nice, but a little overpriced.

Outside trikes are easily available and there are several convenience stores less than a minute away.

title: Nice ride
text:
Easy, efficient, great price. Best way to get from place to place in the Philippines.

Driver was food, all the staff were friendly. Wifi is a real bonus.

title: Crazy
text:
The Sit n Bull ran out of Beer Na Beer so i went to the Sit N Bull Annex. Had the last bottle there. The place hasn’t changed. Great staff, but a bit disorganised for such a small bar. No beer na beer for a week, and the internet was down most of the time.

They have also deleted the coupon special. Go there and you will enjoy a cheap beer without being hassled. The coffee is great too.

Say hi to Angie, she is still just as crazy as before. Fresh waitress Frances Mae loves Jager shots.

New promotions coming shortly ..... i hope

title: Noisy
text:
Took the more expensive seaview suite and was left disappointed. The walls are paperthin so you can hear your neighbours all night.

In addition, staff members calling out, doors slamming, ruined the whole experienced. Compared to other hotels around Baretto, the I Cove is overpriced.

title: Flat
text:
Disorganised, not really what i expected.

It feels like you are there for the staff, not them for you - an inconvenience. I really dont think their job is that difficult. A smile wouldnt hurt.

title: Diana
text:
Friendly check-in on the 30th Floor but was disappointed there was no Executive Lounge Access.

The reception level was tastefully decorated and my room was exceptional. Great bathroom.

All the staff in the Executive Lounge went out of their way to provide perfect service. The best of then was Diana. Well spoken, with a friendly, approachable manner, she made my stay complete. Immaculate grooming with such a beaming smile, she kept herself busy all night making sure every guest felt appreciated. Exactly the type of customer orientated staff member i would expect in a Ritz Carlton.

Well done to management for selecting and training her. A special thanks to Diana for making the effort.

Breakfast is also world class. Fresh, well displayed foods giving you a great choice.

I would definitely choose to stay at the Ritz again.

title: Great views
text:
Easy to visit and worth it to swing by.

I didnt spend long there, but i did enjoy the views and a nearby cafe provided some good coffee.

title: Petra
text:
Great friendly check-in from the lovely Petra. She has helpful and set the tone for a great stay.

Was only there overnight, so I left wishing my stay had been longer.

Great room with a balcony that had an excellent pool and sea view. Executive Lounge was very busy, and well stocked.

Breakfast also gets a big tick.

title: Worth a visit
text:
Easy to get to attraction that can be viewed very quickly. Looks very original and a significant piece of construction.

As a tourist attraction it was not crowded or spoilt by buskers.

Loved the friendly cats who hang out there.

title: Closed
text:
Unfortunately this attraction was closed, but looked worth a visit from the outside.
Still took few pics.

Will give this a visit on my next trip.

title: Service Plus
text:
Modern stylish hotel, in a popular area of Amman.

All the staff I encountered provided excellent service. Eman on reception stood out but the star of my stay was Layla. She was genuinely helpful and went the extra distance to help me out. Very much appreciated.

Breakfast was very good, with a live cooking station and helpful chefs.

My room was spacious, user friendly with a magnificent bathroom.

I can thoroughly recommend this hotel and look forward to staying again.

title: Super Expensive
text:
Went for the Rugby World Cup and was thoroughly disappointed.

Only one faded screen was available to watch the rugby, with limited seating.

The food was delicious but I had to get a large mortgage to cover the costs. Way overpriced. Not enough staff on, and completely disorganised.

Wouldn't go back.

title: Best in JLT
text:
Great location for this classy little , low price restaurant serving delicious food.

The portions are not big, but they are fresh and well presented.

Worth stoping by, it won’t blow your budget.

The waitress is friendly, but it’s very quiet, she needs more guests!!!

title: Surprising
text:
This is a new hotel and offers more than most.

The foyer/reception area is spacious and the rooms are not tiny.

Checkin and checkout were both good, with Nursulu on checkout being very helpful, as are all the staff.

The aircon on the lowest fan setting is still way too poweful, and i hope this can be fixed for my next stay - yes, no hesitation in staying there again.

I understand soon they will open a bar on the 1st floor, and i hope they extend it to their very nice rooftop pool.

Well done management.
place: Hampton By Hilton Dubai Al Barsha

title: Breakie
text:
Helpful stay swoop upon you during arrival.

Friendly checkin with a nice room. The view was good too.

Breakfast was the highlight with a perfect buffet. Good selection of fresh food topped off with an egg cooking station.

The one thing that made breakfast exceptional and indeed the hotel is the staff. Well chosen and well trained , you have got to congratulate management.

The pick of the staff i encountered was Sorita. Well groomed and presented, she was very helpful at breakfast. Great service.

I can recommend this hotel and will stay again.

title: Long
text:
Fun for a walk and to see the locals hanging out. Can’t help but think this could be made into more of a tourist attraction with a little help from the Government.

Good for exercise too.

title: R & R
text:
Nice hotel with reasonable prices but I think it could be a great hotel.

Reina at breakfast was friendly, well presented with a great smile. A touch of class! All the staff were great, and that makes a huge difference.

Raghida on reception stood out with her excellent service. She’s both well trained and well selected so well done management.

Areas for improvement:

1 Internet. This was poor. Disconnected after approx 5 mins continually. So frustrating.

2 Breakfast was the same everyday. Having 10 different cheese type does not make a breakfast. This was 3 star standard. (Except the Humous) Needs a specialty dish or two each day. The Chefs are friendly and definitely capable, give them a little leeway to show their skill.

3 The rooms have spectacular views and are a good size. However, they desperately need an upgrade and some better lighting.

The gym and pool are good. The restaurant and rooms service prices are reasonable, so no need to go outside.

I would stay here again.
place: Four Points by Sheraton Le Verdun
